result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus Lashawn Gates was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Marathon County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Maintain FTE, schooling, combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours community service per week.

No possession or use of controlled substances except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization.

No contact with J.F. unless approved by agent.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

SAFE program.  AODA and comply with any recommendations.  Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate.  

DNA sample.

superMiscConds.notes: Absolutely no contact with victim J.F.
Complete SAFE treatment program. Complete any assessment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent.

Ct 1

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 10:49am
State appears by ADA Matthew Adrian; Deft appears by telephone from WSPS, pro se.

COURT states sentence credit of 84 days in 15CF1126 was correct due to credit be given on 15CF970

COURT ORDERS: DENIES sentence credit request; maintains 84 days credit
Adj: 10:57am
from JA D.M. re: approval of defendant's appearance by phone for 12/14 hearing

from M.G. to Judge re: sentence credit
of Sentencing After Revocation Hearing held before Judge Falstad on 6/14/16
ADA Adrian preparing Stip
CC 9/26/16 @ 1pm - set Hrg
to the Court from DOC dated 8/16/16 re: sentence credit granted during SAR

Clerk: Kimberly
Case called: 8:38am
State appears by ADA Michael Puerner; Defendant appears in person, in custody, with Atty Anne Renc
Date and time set for sentencing on revocation

State says parties are arguing sentencing after revocation
Both parties have received SAR packet
State makes argument on sentencing
Atty Renc makes argument on sentencing
Defendant makes statement
COURT makes findings
COURT ORDERS: 2 years WSPS: 1 year IC, 1 year ES. CONDITIONS of ES: Absolutely No contact with victim- J.F. Complete SAFE treatment program.Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent. Pay CC. Pay DNA sample and surcharge. Pay one domestic abuse surcharge. 84 days credit granted. Deft is eligible for Substance Abuse Programming, not Challenge Incarceration. 

Deft is remanded to MC Sheriff's Dept to be transported to Dodge.

Adj: 9:11am
probation revocation packet
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 3:19 pm
INCLUDES 15CF970 AND 15CF1126. 
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Suzanne O'Neill. 

HEARING IN 15CF970. 
COURT notes letter in 15CF970 indicating def has appellate attorney from the public defender's office. 
Atty O'Neill notes she was unaware of apelleate counsel being appointed. 
Def withdraws request for post-conviction relief. 

SENTENCING AFTER REVOCATION IN 15CF970. 
VRCW. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT ORDERS: On Ct. 2>>6 months MCJ w/ huber for work/treatment/childcare if def qualifies to run concurrent to sentence on Ct. 3 and to probation in 15CF1126. 
                           : On Ct. 3>>90 days MCJ w/ huber for work/treatment/childcare if def qualifies to run concurrent to sentence on Ct. 2 and to probation in 15CF1126. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to 64 days jail credit. 

PLEA HEARING IN 15CF1126. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW.
PLEA: Ct. 1 (DC/DA/DA Repeater)>>GUILTY. 
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
Atty O'Neill makes statement. Def makes statement. 
COURT ORDERS: SWH for 2 years probation - CONDITIONS: SAFE program; AODA and comply with any recommendations; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate; no possession or use of controlled substances except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours CS per week; No dangerous weapons; no contact with J.F. unless approved by agent; DNA sample and surcharge; CC including 1 DA surcharge. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to NO days jail credit if revoked. 
COURT notes probation to start immediately. 

Adj: 3:39 pm
Probable Cause Found
of Preliminary Examination
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 9:56am
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo for ADA Michael Puerner. Deft appears in person, in custody, with Atty Suzanne O'Neill.
Date and time was set for Preliminary Hearing.  

Waiver of Prelim filed.  
COURT ques. Deft re: Waiver. 
COURT finds Waiver freely & vol. made, finds probable cause & binds Deft over for Trial.  
Information filed. Reading Waived.
PLEA: NOT GUILTY
Bond continues
